Technical_easy.questions: What is Power BI, and what are its main components?
Technical_easy.answer: Power BI is a business analytics tool by Microsoft. Its main components include Power BI Desktop (for report development), Power BI Service (for publishing and sharing reports), and Power BI Mobile (for viewing reports on mobile devices).

Technical_easy.questions: What is DAX, and why is it important in Power BI?
Technical_easy.answer: DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) is a formula language used in Power BI to create calculated columns, measures, and custom tables. It is important because it allows you to perform complex calculations and data analysis within Power BI.

Technical_easy.questions: How do you connect to different data sources in Power BI?
Technical_easy.answer: In Power BI Desktop, you can use the 'Get Data' option to connect to various data sources such as SQL Server, Excel, CSV files, APIs, and cloud-based services. You can also use Power BI Dataflows to ingest data in the cloud

Technical_medium.questions: Explain the difference between calculated columns and measures in Power BI.
Technical_medium.answer: Calculated columns are computed at the data model level and stored in the data model. They are evaluated for each row in a table. Measures are calculated on the fly based on the context of the report and are not stored in the data model. Measures are typically used for aggregations and calculations based on filters and slicers.

Technical_medium.questions: How do you optimize a Power BI report for performance?
Technical_medium.answer: To optimize a Power BI report, you can reduce the amount of data loaded, optimize DAX queries, use aggregations, remove unnecessary visuals, and optimize the data model relationships. Using the Performance Analyzer is key.

Technical_medium.questions: Describe the process of implementing Row Level Security (RLS) in Power BI.
Technical_medium.answer: To implement RLS in Power BI, you define roles and filters in Power BI Desktop, then publish the report to Power BI Service. In Power BI Service, you assign users to the defined roles, ensuring they only see the data they are authorized to view.

Technical_hard.questions: How would you design a Power BI solution to handle a large dataset with millions of rows?
Technical_hard.answer: For large datasets, I would use DirectQuery mode to leverage the processing power of the underlying data source. I would also implement aggregations to pre-aggregate data at a higher level, optimize DAX queries, and use incremental refresh to load only the latest data.

Technical_hard.questions: Explain the difference between Import mode, DirectQuery mode, and Composite mode in Power BI, and when would you use each?
Technical_hard.answer: Import mode imports data into the Power BI data model, providing fast performance but requiring regular refreshes. DirectQuery mode queries the data source directly, ensuring real-time data but potentially slower performance. Composite mode allows you to combine both Import and DirectQuery modes in a single report, providing flexibility in data access and performance.

Technical_hard.questions: Describe a scenario where you would use Power BI Dataflows, and how they can improve data management and reporting.
Technical_hard.answer: I would use Power BI Dataflows to create reusable data preparation and transformation logic in the cloud. Dataflows allow you to centralize data transformation processes, improve data quality, and enable self-service BI by providing a consistent data source for multiple reports.
